column4: i have a movie encoded with the "cook" codec (which i have installed in /usr/lib/win32), totem will not play the audio, vlc will not even play the video for some reason, but Kino can play both
anyone know any reason/solution?
it is how the programs check for codecs, totem and kine are not using the same subsystem and vlc has its own
is there a player that uses the same as kine?
you might try mplayer
that gives an error "error opening/initializing the selected video_out (-vo) device"
are you sure you installed the codec correctly?
i installed the w32codecs
and have been happily playing many different video's
(mostly with totem)
ah well I think the problem is its just an obscure codec
have any idea what i can do? i thought about loading it into kino and reencoding the audio stream (not sure if kino can do that)
but it's so massive to load an entire movie into kino it seems, after like 10 minutes of loading, it was only at minute 15
no sorry I don't know enough about your codec
ok, know of a tool that could recode audio streams of a movie?
not on linux :(
aw :<
there probably is one, but I only know about the windows side of movie encoding
ah, will see if my good pal google can help me out then :P
good luck
thanks :)
